predisposition.英释: a tendency to behave in a particular way or suffer from a particular illness

understatement.英释: a statement that is not strong enough to express how good, bad, impressive etc something really is

infrastructure.英释: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

indiscriminate.英释: an indiscriminate action is done without thinking about what harm it might cause

recommendation.英释: official advice given to someone, especially about what to do

schoolmistress.英释: a female teacher, especially in a  private school (= one that parents pay to send their children to )

classification.英释: a process in which you put something into the group or class it belongs to

administration.中释: 管理；行政；实施；行政机构
administration.英释: the activities that are involved in managing the work of a company or organization

circumstantial.中释: 依照情况的；详细的，详尽的；偶然的

accomplishment.英释: something successful or impressive that is achieved after a lot of effort and hard work

correspondence.英释: the process of sending and receiving letters

reconnaissance.中释: [军] 侦察；勘测（等于reconnoissance）；搜索；事先考查
reconnaissance.英释: the military activity of sending soldiers and aircraft to find out about the enemy’s forces

discrimination.英释: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

unprofessional.中释: 非职业性的，非专业的；外行的

congratulation.英释: when you tell someone that you are happy because they have achieved something or because something nice has happened to them

unintelligible.中释: 莫名其妙的；无法了解的

constitutional.英释: a walk you take because it is good for your health

representation.英释: when you have someone to speak, vote, or make decisions for you

microprocessor.英释: the central  chip  in a computer, which controls most of its operations

underdeveloped.英释: a country, area etc that is poor and where there is not much modern industry

counterbalance.英释: to have an equal and opposite effect to something such as a change, feeling etc

troubleshooter.中释: 故障检修工；解决纠纷者；解决麻烦问题的能手
troubleshooter.英释: A troubleshooter is a person whose job is to solve major problems or difficulties that occur in a company or government

disappointment.英释: a feeling of unhappiness because something is not as good as you expected, or has not happened in the way you hoped

irreconcilable.中释: 矛盾的；不能和解的；不能协调的
irreconcilable.英释: irreconcilable positions etc are so strongly opposed to each other that it is not possible for them to reach an agreement

representative.英释: someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

autobiographic.中释: 自传的；自传体的；自传作家的

transportation.中释: 运输；运输系统；运输工具；流放
transportation.英释: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

responsibility.英释: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

respectability.中释: 体面；可尊敬；有社会地位

administrative.英释: relating to the work of managing a company or organization

reconciliation.英释: a situation in which two people, countries etc become friendly with each other again after quarrelling

generalization.英释: a statement about all the members of a group that may be true in some or many situations but is not true in every case

characteristic.英释: a quality or feature of something or someone that is typical of them and easy to recognize

thermodynamics.英释: the science that deals with the relationship between heat and other forms of energy

understandable.中释: 可以理解的；可以了解的
understandable.英释: understandable behaviour, reactions etc seem normal and reasonable because of the situation you are in

uncompromising.中释: 不妥协的，不让步的；坚定的
uncompromising.英释: unwilling to change your opinions or intentions

interpretation.英释: the way in which someone explains or understands an event, information, someone’s actions etc

superintendent.中释: 监督人；负责人；主管；指挥者
superintendent.英释: someone who is in charge of all the schools in a particular area in the US

identification.中释: 鉴定，识别；认同；身份证明
identification.英释: official papers or cards, such as your passport, that prove who you are

interdependent.英释: depending on or necessary to each other

transformation.英释: a complete change in someone or something

impressionable.英释: someone who is impressionable is easily influenced, especially because they are young

insurmountable.中释: 不能克服的；不能超越的；难以对付的
insurmountable.英释: an insurmountable difficulty or problem is too large or difficult to deal with

claustrophobia.英释: a strong fear of being in a small enclosed space or in a situation that limits what you can do

unquestionable.中释: 毫无疑问的；确实的；无可挑剔的
unquestionable.英释: If you describe something as unquestionable, you are emphasizing that it is so obviously true or real that nobody can doubt it

transcendental.中释: 先验的；卓越的，[数] 超越的；超自然的
transcendental.英释: Transcendental refers to things that lie beyond the practical experience of ordinary people, and cannot be discovered or understood by ordinary reasoning

existentialist.英释: If you describe a person or their philosophy as existentialist, you mean that their beliefs are based on existentialism

susceptibility.英释: someone’s feelings, especially when they are easily offended or upset

misappropriate.英释: to dishonestly take something that someone has trusted you with, especially money or goods that belong to your employer
